item.title: Blog: Cloudmesh Burn Release 4.3.11
item.description:
We are happy to announce a new release of the Cloudmesh Pi CLuster software. It includes the following new features:

  • updated USB SDCard detection,
  • updated to support RaspberryOS,
  • removed support for Rasbian,
  • replaced usage of etcher with Raspberry Pi imager,
  • partial support on Linux,
  • partial support on macOS,
  • complete code reorganization.

item.title: Blog: Cloudmesh Pi Burn
item.description:
The Web Page.
Photo: Gregor von Laszewski / CC-BY-CA

Anouncement

We are happy to announce the creation of a new version of Cloudmesh pi burn

cms burn is a program to burn many SD cards for the preparation of building clusters with Raspberry Pi’s. It allows users to create readily bootable SD cards that have the network configured, contain a public ssh key from your machine that you used to configure the cards. Thus not much additional setup is needed for a cluster. Another unique feature is that you can burn multiple cards in a row, each with their individual setup such as hostnames and ipadresses.

A detailed description of Cloudmesh PI burn is available from

  • https://github.com/cloudmesh/cloudmesh-pi-burn/blob/main/README.md

We are also collection Web resources at the following Page:

  • https://cloudmesh.github.io/pi/docs/collection/
